FTP.short_definition: The maximum power you can sustain for approximately 60 minutes. Measured in watts (W).

W/kg.short_definition: Your power output divided by body weight. Critical for climbing performance.

NP.short_definition: Weighted average power that accounts for the physiological cost of power variability.

VI.short_definition: Ratio of Normalized Power to Average Power (NP ÷ AP). Measures pacing consistency.

TSS.short_definition: Quantifies training stress from a workout based on intensity and duration. 100 TSS = 1 hour at FTP.

CTL.short_definition: Your fitness level, calculated as a 42-day rolling average of daily TSS. Also called 'fitness'.

ATL.short_definition: Your fatigue level, calculated as a 7-day rolling average of daily TSS. Also called 'fatigue'.

TSB.short_definition: Your freshness/readiness level (CTL - ATL). Optimal for racing: -5 to +5.

ACWR.short_definition: Ratio of recent training (7 days) to long-term training (28 days). Optimal: 0.8-1.3.

Zone 1.short_definition: 0-60% FTP. Very easy spinning, conversational pace. Promotes recovery without fatigue.

Z1.short_definition: 0-60% FTP. Very easy spinning, conversational pace. Promotes recovery without fatigue.

Zone 2.short_definition: 60-80% FTP. Foundation of aerobic fitness. Builds mitochondrial density and fat oxidation.

Z2.short_definition: 60-80% FTP. Foundation of aerobic fitness. Builds mitochondrial density and fat oxidation.

Zone 3.short_definition: 80-90% FTP. Moderately hard, steady effort. Improves lactate clearance and muscular endurance.

Z3.short_definition: 80-90% FTP. Moderately hard, steady effort. Improves lactate clearance and muscular endurance.

Zone 4.short_definition: 90-110% FTP. Sustained hard effort near lactate threshold. Your 'race pace' for 20-60 min efforts.

Z4.short_definition: 90-110% FTP. Sustained hard effort near lactate threshold. Your 'race pace' for 20-60 min efforts.

Zone 5.short_definition: >110% FTP. Very hard intervals (2-8 min). Expands aerobic ceiling and maximum oxygen uptake.

Z5.short_definition: >110% FTP. Very hard intervals (2-8 min). Expands aerobic ceiling and maximum oxygen uptake.

EF.short_definition: Ratio of Normalized Power to average heart rate (NP ÷ HR). Rising EF indicates improving aerobic efficiency.

Pa:HR.short_definition: Compares power/HR ratio in first vs. second half of ride. <5% indicates strong aerobic base.

TTE.short_definition: How long you can sustain FTP before failure. Well-trained: 35-50 minutes.

VO2 Max.short_definition: Maximum rate your body can consume oxygen during maximal exercise (ml/kg/min). Sets your aerobic ceiling.

Lactate Threshold.short_definition: Exercise intensity where lactate accumulates faster than it can be cleared. Closely related to FTP.

Polarized Training.short_definition: ~80% training time easy (Z1-Z2), ~20% hard (Z4-Z5+), minimal Z3. Used by elite endurance athletes.

Pyramidal Training.short_definition: Most time in Z2, moderate in Z3/Z4, small amount in Z5. Common among masters/time-limited athletes.

Threshold Training.short_definition: Heavy focus on Z3-Z4 work (40-50% training time). Rapidly improves FTP but high burnout risk.

Periodization.short_definition: Systematic planning of training into phases: Base → Build → Peak → Recovery → Race.

Deload Week.short_definition: Planned recovery week with 40-60% volume reduction every 3-4 weeks. Allows body to absorb training stress.

Progressive Overload.short_definition: Gradually increasing training stress over time. Typically 5-10% weekly TSS increase when building.

Durability.short_definition: Ability to maintain power late in long rides. Measured by comparing final hour vs. first hour power.

Sweet Spot.short_definition: Upper Zone 3 (~88-93% FTP). Substantial stimulus without excessive fatigue. Efficient for time-limited athletes.

Cadence.short_definition: Pedal revolutions per minute (rpm). Typically 85-95 rpm for endurance, 95-105 for climbing.

Power-Duration Curve.short_definition: Graph showing best power outputs across durations (5s, 1min, 5min, 20min, 60min). Reveals your phenotype.

Consistency Score.short_definition: Percentage of planned sessions completed. High consistency: >85% sessions, low weekly variation.
